Title: Rigidity theorems for diameter estimates of compact manifold with boundary
Abstract: © The Author(s) 2014. Published by Oxford University Press. All rights reserved.Let (N, g) be an n-dimensional complete Riemannian manifold with nonempty boundary ∂N. Assume that the Ricci curvature of (N, g) has a negative lower boundRic≥-(n- 1)c<sup>2</sup> for some c>0, and the mean curvature of the boundary ∂N satisfies H ≥ (n- 1)c<inf>0</inf> > (n- 1)c for some c<inf>0</inf> >c>0. Then a known result (cf. [12]) says that sup<inf>x∈N</inf> d(x, ∂N) ≤ 1/c coth<sup>-1</sup> c<inf>0</inf>/c. In this paper, we prove the rigidity result that if N is compact, then the equality holds if and only if (N, g) is isometric to the geodesic ball of radius 1/c coth<sup>-1</sup> c<inf>0</inf>/c in an n-dimensional hyperbolic space ℍ<inf>n</inf>(-c<sup>2</sup>) of constant sectional curvature -c<sup>2</sup>.Moreover, we prove an analogous result for manifold with m-Bakry-Émery Ricci curvature bounded below by a negative constant.
